City Council

Hudson City Council is a governing body responsible for making decisions and policies at the local level within the city of Hudson. Its primary role is to represent the interests of the community and ensure the effective functioning of local government. ***The City Council of the City of Hudson meets regularly on the 2nd Thursday of each month at 5:00 pm unless otherwise determined by Council action***

 

 

Date of next officer election:  May 2, 2026

Location of election:    Hudson City Hall - 3458 Ted Trout Dr. Hudson, TX 75941 

 

Elected Officials and the year their terms expire:
 
Mayor Terry Taliaferro - 2026
Council Member Frankie Ornduff - 2026
Council Member Philip Novak - 2026
Council Member Phil Adkison - 2027
Council Member Juan Ramos - 2027
Council Member Caleb Ramsey - 2027
 
 
Candidate eligibility requirements:
 
Mayor: Residence - One (1) year in the State before the filing deadline; One (1) year in the city before election day.
            Age - Eighteen (18)
            Must be a registered voter in the territory elected by the filing deadline.
 
Council Member: Residence - One (1) year in the State before the filing deadline; six months in the city before the filing deadline (Texas Election Code, Section 141.00(a); Brown v. Patterson, 609 SW 2nd 287)
                                Age - Eighteen (18)
                                Must be a registered voter in the territory elected by the filing deadline.
 
Deadline to file candidate application:   February 14, 2025 @ 5:00 pm
 
 
 

 

 

To run for City Council please contact the City Secretary at 936-875-2358 ext. 102

Contact Info

Candy Cox
City Secretary
936-875-2358 ext. 102
hcs@cityofhudson.net

Support Local Animal Shelter

Looking for a furry friend to become a part of your family? Consider adopting a dog or cat from your local animal shelter. An adopted pet will provide unconditional love and companionship to all.
